definitions: To rotate 180 degrees so as to face in the opposite direction.
To cause something to face in the opposite direction.
To change a failing situation into a successful one.
To complete a task or process within a certain timeframe.
examples: She asked him to turn around so she could see his back.
The company managed to turn around its financial performance.
We need to turn around this project by Friday.
He turned around the car in the narrow street.
